titles.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4) to restore the American family, reduce illegitimacy, control welfare spending and reduce welfare dependence.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-85, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Providing for the further consideration of the bill, without futher general debate. An amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of H.R. 1214 shall be considered as adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as the original bill for the purpose of further amendment under the 5 minute rule. Specified amendments are in order. No further amendment to the bill shall be in order except the amendments specified in the report accompanying this resolution, the en bloc amendments in section 2, and the amendments in section 3 of this resolution. Each resolution shall be debatable for 20 minutes. The Chairman of the Committee of the Whole may postpone until a later tim...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 35.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 211 (Roll no. 255).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/21/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the modified closed rule for the consideration of H.R. 4 (Personal Responsibility Act of 1995).
